bibl.title: Letter from Pedro Nogueira to Jefferson Randolph Kean, September 7, 1947

div1.p: Nogueira inquires if any of the volunteers at Camp Lazear died from the yellow fever experiments.

div1.head: Letter from Pedro Nogueira to Jefferson Randolph Kean, September 7, 1947
div1.opener:
DR. PEDRO NOGUEIRA
MEDICO CIRUJANO
MARTI 219, MARIANAO
TELEFONOS: FO-7577
FO-7392
Marianao September 7 - 1947
Brig. Gen. Jefferson. R. Kean
2804 N - Street.- N. W.
Washington. D.C.
U.S.A.
Dear Dr Kean:
div1.p:
In view of your conecction with the work of the Ame-
rican Comision at Camp Lazear, I am taking the liberty
of requesting that you inform me if there were any
losses suffered among the volunteers, due to the expe-
riments carried out by the Comission at that Camp; for
although the Comission made no report of same, from the
work of Dr Espin it appears that during the experiments
al least one volunteer died as a result of the inocula-
tions.

Thanking you for this information, I remain with
my best wishes for your health,
